meanings.definition: A popular text editor used for programming and other tasks.
meanings.sent1: I use emacs to write code for my computer science class.
meanings.sent2: Programmers often rely on emacs for their coding projects.
meanings.sent3: The student accidentally deleted his entire essay while learning how to use emacs.
meanings.sent4: In the world of coding, emacs is like a trusty toolbox full of helpful tools.
meanings.sent5: Using emacs feels like having a magic pen that can bring your ideas to life on the screen.

meanings.definition: To edit text using the Emacs text editor.
meanings.sent1: She emacs her documents to make sure they are error-free.
meanings.sent2: Remember to emacs your code before submitting it for review.
meanings.sent3: He decided to emacs his email one last time before sending it out.
meanings.sent4: Editing with emacs is like polishing a gem to make it shine brighter.
meanings.sent5: The writer carefully emacs each sentence to ensure clarity and precision.

meanings.definition: The name of a specific text editor program.
meanings.sent1: Have you tried the new version of emacs?
meanings.sent2: I prefer using emacs over other text editors.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocked over the cup of coffee onto the keyboard running emacs.
meanings.sent4: In the world of text editing, emacs stands out as a reliable choice.
meanings.sent5: When it comes to coding efficiency, emacs is a name that always comes up.
